description: Following the installation of the security updates addressing CVE-2024-43520, users may experience a total denial of system access, effectively rendering the system unusable. This condition emerges particularly after the machine resumes from sleep mode, leading to situations where applications may freeze or crash unexpectedly. The impact affects multiple builds, including Windows 10 (10.0.22631.4317 and 10.0.22000.3260) and Windows 11 (10.0.26100.2033), as identified in the corresponding KB articles (KB5044284, KB5044285, and KB5044286). System administrators should monitor for these behaviors as they can severely disrupt normal operations and user productivity. The severity of this issue is classified as important, necessitating prompt attention to ensure a stable operational environment.
